feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 12:04PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 10:06PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of Arkansas, Louisiana, and Texas, including the following areas, in Arkansas, Columbia, Lafayette, Miller, and Union. In Louisiana, Bienville, Bossier, Caddo, Claiborne, De Soto, Jackson, Lincoln, Ouachita, Red River, Union, and Webster.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 21 at 10:21PM MST until August 21 at 10:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR WEST CENTRAL PIMA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 1030 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However heavy rain is still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 21 at 10:21PM MST until August 21 at 10:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR WEST CENTRAL PIMA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 1030 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However heavy rain is still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 10:12PM MST until August 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 1012 PM MST, Heavy rainfall continues across Kingman and Golden Valley with flooding reported. Heaviest rainfall has occured in the Hualapai Mountains where numerous roads have been closed by flood waters. Additional flooding has occured in Golden Valley.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 10:07PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern La Paz and Maricopa Counties through 1045 PM MST... At 1007 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Buckskin Mountain Park to 9 miles northeast of Bouse to 8 miles northwest of Wenden to near Gladden. Movement was southwest at 35 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Parker Valley

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 9:17PM MST until August 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River near Solomon from 21 to 20.5 ft.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 12:45PM ChST by NWS
entry.summary: .A weak tropical disturbance is generating showers and thunderstorms across Guam. This activity is capable of producing locally heavy rainfall that could result in minor flooding over Guam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CHST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Guam.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 11:03PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG MAY POSE A HAZARD TO MOTORISTS EARLY MONDAY MORNING... Patchy dense fog is expected to develop across the area during the early morning hours. The fog could reduce the visibility to less than 1/4 mile in places, resulting in locally hazardous travel conditions.
